alert.note: Alert for Harrison; Pottawattamie; Shelby (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 23 at 5:27AM CDT until April 23 at 6:00AM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: The National Weather Service in Omaha has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Central Pottawattamie County in southwestern Iowa... Southeastern Harrison County in southwestern Iowa... Southwestern Shelby County in southwestern Iowa... * Until 600 AM CDT. * At 526 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Treynor, or 22 miles east of Omaha, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Minden around 540 AM CDT. Avoca and Shelby around 545 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Harlan. This includes the following highways... Interstate 29 between mile markers 47 and 48. Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 5 and 43. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
